title: Maureen O'Hara
summary: Maureen O'Hara (born Maureen FitzSimons; 17 August 1920 – 24 October 2015) was an Irish actress and singer, who became successful in Hollywood throughout the 1940s to '60s.[1] She was a natural redhead who was known for playing passionate but sensible heroines, often in Westerns and adventure films. Her star potential was first recognized by actor Charles Laughton, who brought her to Hollywood; and on numerous occasions, she worked with director John Ford and longtime friend John Wayne.
